To the Editor: Reading Martha Weinman Lear's essay ''Born and Bred (and Banned) in Boston,'' (Sept. 24) felt as if I were reading my own words, better written.

I, too, was born and bred in Boston, but have lived in New York for over 30 years. I adore New York, but find Boston lures me back often, both to reacquaint myself with my past and to familiarize myself with the pres ent. Boston has extraordinary charm -- which I took for granted as a youth and now enjoy being steeped in. With the new accouterments, it is a pleasant place to visit.
What is startling about Boston, however, is how expensive it has become. It's making New York seem more pocketbook friendly!
